full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 731-2 Filed 07/14/22 Page 3 of 3 PANISH SHEA & BOYLE LLP The Honorable Alison J. Nathan December 15, 2021 Page 3 To the extent the Court were to compel Mr. Glassman's testimony, Mr. Glassman would need time to consult ethics counsel and perhaps the California State Bar. We would also respectfully request that any testimony be conducted remotely to prevent the time, expense, and COVID risk in light of what should be extremely limited testimony. Respectfully submitted, /s/ Kevin Boyle PANISH SHEA & BOYLE LLP 1111 Santa Monica Blvd., Ste. 700 Los Angeles, CA 90025 Phone: 310-477-1700 Attorneys for Witness Jane Cc: Counsel of record DOJ-OGR-00011423

text_blocks.content: The Honorable Alison J. Nathan December 15, 2021 Page 3

To the extent the Court were to compel Mr. Glassman's testimony, Mr. Glassman would need time to consult ethics counsel and perhaps the California State Bar. We would also respectfully request that any testimony be conducted remotely to prevent the time, expense, and COVID risk in light of what should be extremely limited testimony.
PANISH SHEA & BOYLE LLP 1111 Santa Monica Blvd., Ste. 700 Los Angeles, CA 90025 Phone: 310-477-1700 Attorneys for Witness Jane Cc: Counsel of record

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court filing with a letterhead from the law firm PANISH SHEA & BOYLE LLP. The content is a formal request regarding testimony in a court case.
